block.p: The pianists Edward Aldwell and Richard Goode are to perform a benefit recital on Dec. 16 at 8 P.M. at Mannes College of Music, 150 West 85th Street, Manhattan. The proceeds are to go to the Sheila Aldendorff Scholarship Fund -- named for a pianist and teacher -- to help students in the college's preparatory division. Mr. Aldwell will perform Bach's "French" Suite No. 6 and Chopin's Fantasy (Op. 49); Mr. Goode is to play Beethoven's Sonatas Nos. 26 and 27; both artists, who are Mannes faculty members, will play the four-hand version of Ravel's "Mother Goose" Suite. Tickets are $25 and $50. Information: (212) 496-8524.

The proceeds are to go to the Sheila Aldendorff Scholarship Fund -- named for a pianist and teacher -- to help students in the college's preparatory division. Mr. Aldwell will perform Bach's "French" Suite No. 6 and Chopin's Fantasy (Op. 49); Mr. Goode is to play Beethoven's Sonatas Nos. 26 and 27; both artists, who are Mannes faculty members, will play the four-hand version of Ravel's "Mother Goose" Suite. Tickets are $25 and $50. Information: (212) 496-8524.
